text: On tap at Wicked Weed Funkatorium in Asheville, NC. Aroma is sharp Brett funk (the funkiest of the WW Funkatorium I had), tart berries, berry must. Taste is unripe berries and chalky, sharp cheddar funk. Excellent one.

From a bottle. Pours cranberry red and makes a medium pink head. Smells of read with me and dankiness. Tastes of dark fruits and berries and a beautiful sourness. Yum. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A 500ml bottle, bottled on 8th January 2016. Poured into a Lost Abbey teku glass. It was a cloudy raspberry red colour with a two finger off white head that had good retention and left nice sticky lacing. Aromas of red wine gum berry candy, vinous, oak, earthiness and a light funk. Tastes very lightly sour, raspberries, mixed berries, vinous, oak and slightly funky. Medium to light bodied with moderate carbonation and a dry-ish finish. Overall I tend to enjoy these berry flavoured Wild Ales and this was no different. It was surprisingly not very sour at all, but the oak barrel character in the aroma and taste was quite strong. Definitely enjoyable.
500ml bottle. Deep red with a foamy white head. Flavors are blackberry/raspberry jam and oak with vinous notes. Light to medium body, moderate carbonation, smooth texture.

Pale medium red pour with a thin ring of white/pink head and fizzy .... Aroma is of mostly tart raspberry and sour, along with earthy blackberry ... Flavor is slightly sweet and light acidic with a natural earthy tart, raspberry, blackcurrant and some dry oak with red wine flavors on the back end ... Body is medium and the finish is dry with oak, lingering tart berry and red wine .... solid and tasty stuff .... very sessionable and moderately sour not too acidic
Hazy reddish color with a medium white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Lots of berries, wood, wine, tart skins, sour finish.

Bottle 500ml. Thx Big T.
Pours dark pink/ reddish with low beige head. Aroma is of blackberries, blueberries. Taste is of blackberries, blueberries. Palate: Light-medium body, soft carbonation. Overall: Very nice balance. Nothing overdone.
Blood red with some purple. Creamy head. Smells like raspberry and cherry. Holy sour. But only after the initial raspberry aftertaste. Cherry and raspberryfinish. Wine tart sour and chalky

Bottle. Pinkish purple maroon body, thin white head. Wood, lacto, berry seeds, slight dark fruit in the aroma. Flavor is berry rich and slightly wild on that front, jam, woody sour finish. Medium body.

Raspberry and blackberry fruit with lactic sour. Slight sweet fruit flavors but balanced well by the sour. Maybe 4 of 10 sour. Slight light palate and maybe slight watery for a sour. Overall complex, balanced, sour and well done.

I was blown away by this beer. I was expecing just a sour, but itÂ’s so complex, so full of different flavours that it was hard to believe. ItÂ’s so fruity, tart, refreshing, crips. Soo drinkable. Really like it.

Bottle from Beercraft. It pours a mostly clear deep reddish purple color with a fizzy off white head. The aroma is full with blackberries and minor notes of raspberries. Very faint whiffs of red wine vinegar, bread and funk. The flavor has a nice balance of very tart blackberries/raspberries and some berry sweetness. The sourness is by far the strongest sensation. Dry, fairly light on the palate with solid carbonation. The finish has a little noticeable barnyard funk and a touch of smoky phenol. Not getting any vinegar in the flavor. Overall, very nice.

Bottle thanks to Kurt! Pours clear reddish amber, medium beige head, dissipates to good residual and decent lacing. Aroma is berries, hints of funk, oak tannin, vinous notes. Flavor is quite light on the tartness, oak tannins and red wine blend with forest berries and a bit of earthy funk. Medium body, nice soft carbonation. This is a pretty refined beer.

Pours a clear cherry red with a thin white head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is of cherries and other berries. Pretty juicy and certainly not jammy. Taste is more of the bright cherries and is moderately tart. Vinous with a moderate body and medium carbonation. A very light syrupy feel. A pretty nice cherry sour but kind of far from their Red Angel to me.

Bottle (500 ml), shared at tasting. Clear bright reddish-pink with a small white head leaving good lacing. Aroma is delicate with plenty of raspberries and blackberries, red wine and light minerality. Taste is fruity (raspberries, blackberries) with red wine, mineral notes, gentle tartness and light oak presence. Medium body. Moderate-medium carbonation. Winey mouthfeel. Fruity finish. Very good. Delicate, complex, not too sour and rather easy drinking.

bottle shared by tom10101, thanks brah! pours cloudy red-purple with a nice off-white cap offering good retention and lacing. vibrant raspberries, red matter, red wine barrels with just a few tannins, rustic earthy beets, white chocolate traces, light acidity - complex acid molecules. moderate carbonation, light body, dry and tart woodsy-spicy-fruity finish. very solid wine barrel-aged berry tart ale.

Bottle. Deep red with moderate, ruby, thick head. Good head retention and moderate lacing. Nice forrest fruits aroma, lots of fresh raspberries and blackberries. Clean big lacto and sourness, maybe just a hint of brett. Also nice medium, oaky, red wine barrel character. Taste is very lactic, tart and moderately sour. Nice, dry, oaky, lacto, finish, very fresh. Medium body, oily and semi-thick texture. Really complex, nice killer. Extremely forrest fruits aromas and flavors. Could be a little more funky.

500ml bottle from Dominion Wine and Beer
Aroma: red wine, blackberries and raspberries, 
Appearance: hazy pink-golden with a thin white head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium sourness, 
Palate: medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, tart finish
Tasty

500 ml bottle from Bottles & Bitters at SloanÂ’s Lake. Hazy reddish to amber appearance. Aroma of sour fruit, tart berries, light barnyard funk, a touch of toasted oak and hints of red wine. Similar flavor, sour, fruity, lightly funky and vinous with a mildly tart, puckering mouth feel. Soft carbonation with a smooth finish. Nice!
Shared 500ml bottle. Hazy reddish copper with a cream-colored head. Aroma and taste of blackberry, raspberry, funk, sourness, vinegar. Some acidity. Tart finish.

Aroma: extremely sweet and juicy, like jam; tiny but of funk; Appearance: glowing red with thin white head that lingers; Taste: tart and sour, fruity, funky; nicely complex; Palate: medium-light body with long, tart finish; Overall: really nice sour ale; would definitely get again.
Bottle from friend. Hazy reddish amber with off white pink head. Sour fruity with berries, wine and light funk. Semi sour with medium carbonation. Great sour!

May 12, 2016. On tap at Himmeriget.
Light hazy purple with a small off-white head. Aroma is tart fruits and light funk with tart and juicy blackberries, raspberries, grapes, black currants, lemon, hay and oak. Taste is sour and fruity. Light to medium bodied, dry, average carbonation. Dry and tart finish with juicy berries, light funk, minerals oak and spicy herbal notes. 
Drinkable and refreshing sour with nice berry presence.

(500ml bottle from Mikkeller Webshop shared) Pours deep pink-red with orange tinges and a large off white head and a wall of lace. Aroma of fresh raspberries and blackberries with oak, light musty funk, subtle vanilla. Flavour of rose wine, light infused raspberry flesh, oaky, slight vanilla, woody astringency, subtle cellar, berry seeds. Lightly tart and quite dry, a bit mineral. Smooth medium body with high effervescent carb. Pulls a ton of fresh fruit nose out of the relatively low fruiting rate, but the palate is more balanced between fruit and barrel notes. TheyÂ’re very complimentary though, and the whole package is quite elegant if not jammy.

Bottle:
Pours nearly clear red/amber with a thin white head.
HUGE blackberry and raspberry aroma with a touch of vinegar.
Taste is sweet mixed berry, tart wine and wood.....nice dry finish.
Excellent.

Bottle from Kihoskh, Copenhagen. Pours a deep purple-hued clear pink body with a medium off-white head. Nose is blackberried, blueberries, rasberries, wood, vanilla, red wine and hints of farmhouse funk, red fruits and hay. Taste is tart dark berries, barnyard funk, wood and hints of vanilla, raspberries, blackberries, citrus and hay. Light body, medium to high carbonation. Lovely balanced sour, full of dark berries and mild funk. Elegant and tasty.

500ml bottle at home. Bottled 01.08.2016. brown / redish clear color, small off-white head. smells of wood, wine barrel notes, sour, acidic, nice berry notes, some green apples, marzipan, lovely rather clean smell. medium to full body, rather bubbly carbonation, light mouthfeel. tastes of wood, citric, green apples, some funk, some berry notes, nutty. finishes rather dry and medium sour with citric, green apple and some nutty notes. lovely beer, especially loved the smell, taste lacks a bit and even comes around as a bit thin. overall still very nice beer.

Bottle shared thanks to Marius. Very hazy amber with a small off white head. Aroma of big raspberry and blackberry, huge tart dark berries with lactic notes. Flavour is light moderate sweet and above moderate sour. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Bottle. Somewhat burgundy red. Funky aroma of freshly picked raspberries. Jammy, balanced, maybe one of the more balanced american sours I have tasted. Dry and funky. Good.

UPDATED: OCT 8, 2016 Przypomina bardzo fajnie zbalansowanego framboise - malina, czerwone porzeczki, wytrawne wino, troch? brettÃ³w, winogron i tanin od beczki... Bardzo przyjemne, nie przegiete w zadna strone i w zapachu i w smaku.

Bottle. Hazy amber red with a frothy, amber head with a red tint; lasts in a ring and laces. Aromas of tart raspberries, wood, funk, light lemon. Flavor is tart raspberry, blackberry, funk, wood, light floral and spicy earth notes. Medium bodied, smooth with a dry, tart end. Slight carbonation and acidity.
Aroma of Red currant , raspberry, blackberry, oak, barn, dirt. Taste is light sour, light sweet and dry. Flavor of different berries, grapes, wine. Very nice brew.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking a Medora by Wicked Weed Brewing at Chmielarnia MarszaÅ‚kowskaFramboise takie fajowe, kazdy lyk i niuch troche inny, delikatnie dziko skorzano-ziemiste, kwasnosc skontrowana owocowoscia, klasaOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Bottle. Strong raspberry/blackberry, red wine, toffee malt, and hay aroma. Copper with minimal head. Mildly sweet raspberry/blackberry, light merlot, toffee malt, and mildly bitter hay flavor. Great balance and body. Delicious.

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2016 Draft at the Khyber. Clear deep ruby pour with soft beige foam. Nice splashes of lace.Pungent berry sour with a ton of flavor. Raspberry. Blackberry. Currant. Plum. Pomegranate. Hibiscus. Wonderful tannic elements from both the fruit and wood. Jammy, bright and refreshing.
A: Cloudy brown/red coloured with a thin white head. N: Fresh raspberry pits, blackberry, light hint of toffee T: Raspberry, orange, pomelo O: Very easy drinking, but quite nice.

Pours amber with a small off white head. Aroma is blackberry, raspberry, earthy, light funk and floral. Taste is sour with lactic undertones. Light bodied, crisp and lots of raspberry coming through on the finish.

Bottle (thanks Scott!). Pours a plum color that appears a brilliant ruby red when held directly to the light. An off-white head that fairly quickly fades to a healthy ring around the glass. Minimal lacing left behind. Big berry aroma with Brett underneath -- more refined than funky. Very nice. Taste is moderate to medium tart with light sweetness underneath. Berries. A drying finish.

Reddish brown hue with a thin white head with hints of pink. Bright tart aromas matched by a raspberry tart flavor with a medium body and dry finish

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle. Sour grape aroma with notes of raspberry, blackberry, Brett and oak. Pours fuschia colored with a thin white head that has poor retention some lacing. Starts with sweet blackberry and raspberry flavors with notes of spicy Brett. Finishes dry and tarts with red wine character and tannins as well as a bit of oak. Excellent sour.

Bottle courtesy of mariuspoenari. Hazy reddish with white head. Big sweet raspberry, mild sour fruitiness. Grapes, light grape stones. Medium body, well carbonation. Milky texture. Minerallike texture. Great!

Bottle shared thanks to MariusPoenari. Hazy amber with off white head.
Massive berries up front, some yoghurt, berry candy, light berbs and minerals. Medium sour and very light bitter and sweet. Medium bodied with a bit fizzy carbonation. Nice one.
Bottle shared at Klooster. Dark ruby pour with a thin off-white head. Notes of raspberry, blackberry, fructose, tart. Nedium body, medium to high carbonation and a siur fruity finish.

Aroma and taste is medium sour showcasing a plethora of berry fruits, tart berry fruity finish.
From tap. Hazy reddish colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of fruit, sourness, raspberries, blackberries, citrus, oak and juicy.

On tap at Monks, cloudy crimson color with average sized head and not much lacing. Smell and flavor is raspberry jam, blackberry seed, oak, vino and lemon skins. Medium in body. Lots of acidity and salivating sourness but not over the top. Impressed with most of these beer this outing.

Lota of raspberries here and smaller notes pf blackberries. Fruit blends well with red wine elements. Pours hazy red with decent head and lacing. Tangy finish with sharp astringent oak note. Tap at brewery.

Draught @ Himmeriget, Aaboulevard 27, DK-1960 Copenhagen N, Denmark. [ As Wicked Weed Medora Blackberry Raspberry Sour ].Unclear medium red color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white - pink head. Aroma is moderate malty, sour, tart, earthy, raspberry, blackberry. Flavor is moderate sweet and light acidic with a long duration, tart, raspberry, blackcurrant, earthy. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160512]

Draft at the WW taproom. Ruby. Raspberry yogurt aroma. Taste is Medium sour. Acidic raspberry. Oak, tannic wine. Slight funk. Fruit is more subdued in this than most American fruited sours, which seems to be the case with most of these WW sours. More of the sour beer and oak come through.

500 ml bottle bottle from Wicked Weed shared with Tmoney99. Pours a hazy reddish/purple/amber color with a medium sized pinkish head. The aroma and flavor have nice raspberry/blackberry fruit character, tart, some acidity, wood, red wine, tannins, hints of citrus, very nice beer.

Bottle @ home shared by Caesar. Hazy red pink color, average sized beige colored head. Aroma is nicely sour red fruits which I guess is a mix of raspberries and blackberries. Taste sour red fruits, slightly peach, raspberries, lightly tannine (is that the red wine?) lightly sour, lightly dry. Lingering red fruits dry finish. Quite nice!
Bottle from Firma Bier, date bottled 01.08.16, medium sample. Hazy reddish color, short frothy head. Aroma is very fruity, raspberry, marzipan, funky. Slight sour in taste, fruity.

Bottle shared by alexsdad06. Poured a hazy reddish amber color that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy sour yeast and berry aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy sour fruit flavor with a medium to heavy sour finish of moderate to long duration. This is a standout beer.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy reddish color. Aroma and taste are blackberries, raspberries, and some wine. Dry finish and light tartness.
Bottle kindly shared by O. Pours a clear reddish purple with pinkish head. Big raspberry and blackberry aroma with some oak and vanilla. Similar taste. Tart and refreshing with slight citrusy notes.
Bottle shared by a friend. Clear amber to red in color with a medium off-white head. Nose of funk, berry and malt. Malt and blackberry flavor with tartness before a raspberry and funk finish.

500 ml bottle at Fermentoren, Copenhagen Denmark. Pours a clear red body, with a slight pink head. Aromas of raspberries, blueberries, cherries. Taste is sour and funky, with berries of all kind exploding in your mouth!! Leather and wood as well. Light to medium body with medium carbonation. Magnificent!

Really like this for my first try with WW. Pours opaque ruby brown with thin lace of head in glass around edge. Tart but not overpowering. Fairly substantial body compared to most sours. Really great stuff.

500 ml bottle shared by ClarkVV. Bottled on 1/08/2016. Color is a light violet purple with thin white head. Aroma is exactly as you would expect, blackberry, light raspberry, light oak. 
The flavor shows me mild tartness with a ton of berries. Huge berry character with oak and wine note in the finish. Mild tannic oak. Honestly, very tame and approachable. Would make a nice introduction to a person who has little knowledge of sour / wild ales. Pretty easy drinking.

Bottled 1/8/16, drunk 7/24/16.Clear raspberry-auburn with a thin off-white head.Raspberry and brett are clean and clear in the nose. Very mild funk, light wheat perhaps. It all adds up to a very tart, light, golden ale with a good fruitiness. No alcohol or flaw. Lots of black pepper and raspberry seed.Lightly sugary in the mouth, with soft raspberry juice, lots of seed and black pepper. Low carbonation, somewhat tight with a big attenuation and lots of dryness resulting. Very light-hearted and low on the acidity but thereÂ’s that nagging powdered sugar character that I donÂ’t care for.
Poured from bottle dated 1/8/16 thanks ClarkVV reddish orange pour with a thin white head. Aromas of sour funk dark fruit and earth. Taste is tart berry mild funk medium vinegar.

Bottle, 6.6%. Slightly hazy red / dark amber with small tan head. Aroma is malt, berries, blackberries, raspberries, lemon and tart. Flaovur is malt, lemon, berries, blackberries, raspberries, medium dry, little sweet, sour, citric, tart and wood.
Great sampler from the Funkatorium. 6oz pours? 7oz pours? Dark berries in the nose. Tart more than sour in the taste. Very tasty and well blended. 14.8
Bottle from Voldby. Hazy red brown with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, raspberries and tart. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 150716
Bottle at home. Cloudy red body with a medium pink head. Raspberries, blackberries, funky, light vinegar, red apples, tartness, light bitter end. I like it.

sample, poured a deep red colour with a light pink head on top. nose is hit with a truckload of fruits, nice tart raspberry, berries, blackberry, vinous grape notes, oak, vanilla, vinager wicked weed funk i think, light cinnamon sweetness of fruit pits, citrus, nice balanced tart finish. awesome, and amazing label

Muddy ruby red, a more luminous tone than the other beers I tried from Wicked Weed. Aroma wise, itÂ’s pretty straightforward but also intense and elegant. Raspberry notes with mineral, peppery notes and a lemony acidity. The palate follows suit, with a sharper tartness, enriched by the notes of the barrel and the slight, faint, suggestive notes of funk. Wicked Weed shows a very good hand with barrel aging, blending and wild yeasts, giving itÂ’s beers extra depth without ever compromising drinkability. Spritzy and lively, the beer lingers on your palate quite a while. Pleasantly dry, but not as dry as other offerings. Very good, on par with the greatest Belgian lambics.
Bottle @ "Where is Rasmus? v. 1.0". Reddish pour with a pinkish head. Tons of juicy berries, raspberries, blackberries, blueberries, tannins, vinous, oak and some light vanilla.

Bottle from Kihoskh, shared with _angst_. Hazy reddish ruby beer with a nice lasting offwhite head. Sourish fruity aroma, raspberries, tart, blackberry notes, grapes, vinous, some wood. Sourish raspberry and blackberry flavor, cherry seeds, grapes, tart notes, floral, some wild strawberries, woody, vinous notes. Well balanced sour with lots of berries and nice wine barrels.

Bottle. Aroma of raspberry, citrus, blackberry, red wine, wood. 
Pours a beautiful dark red with a one finger off white head. 
Taste is medium sour and medium to lightly sweet. Taste is a little more vinous with a slight vinegar presence. Otherwise very fruity and pleasant. 
Medium to light body, fresh and easy drinking, average carbonation and a slightly dry finish. 
Delicious sour!

Bottled. Pours hazy Amber with a small off-white head. Aroma of red wine, black- and raspberries and wood notes. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up being dry and tart. Medium bodied, watery to oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent Sour. ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ

Bottle shared. Pours murky dark orange with a small offwhite head. Aromas of raspberries, blackberries, berry pits, oaky, vinous, red grapes, vinegary, jammy. Taste is dark deep blackberries, sour raspberries, lactic, light vinegary, subtle funk, dry berry pits.
Bottle at Cotteridge Wines tasting room; hazy peach pour with a thin beige head, aroma has raspberry and some tart black fruits, taste has raspberry, tart berries, some jammy action, some citrus.

[5/12/16] Draught at Himmeriget in Copenhagen. Lovely deep red. Amazing aroma full of juicy berries, some funk, oak. Tart flavor, full of juicy berries, some funk and lacto. Rounded mouthfeel. Wonderful.

From tap at Himmeriget, Copenhagen. Red color with off white pinkish head. Light malty, yeasty aroma, fruity, berries - raspberries - blueberries, funky. Sweet and acidic funky fruity taste. Light to medium oily body with soft carbonation.
Bottle. Poured an amberish / copperish color with an off white head. Berries (raspberries & other berries), funky, and some woodiness.
Tap.Hazy reddish brown colour with small head.Aroma is fruity more of raspberrieies then blackberries,nice mild sourish and tart dry fruity with nice dry finish.
From tap. Pours hazy amber with a small white head. Aroma is fruity, berries. Dry and fruity. Crisp fruity. Lingering fruity, dry and smooth fruity. Crisp citric into a mellow finish.

From tap at Himmeriget. ItÂ’s a deep reddish beer with a creamy off white head. The aroma is loaded with berries. Raspberry in front. Some tart notes. Tart fruity flavor with lots of juicy berries. A treat!

Tap at Himmeriget. Aroma of citrus, raspberry, blackBerry. Zesty, fruity, fresh. Wooden notes. The flavours starts sweet but turns sour before finishing dry. The body is light and the texture is juicy.
Tap @ Himmeriget. Pours hazy pinkish reddish with a white head. Berries.. All over. Juicy, fresh and tart. Lovely!

On tap at Himmeriget. Hazy red with a small white head. Great funky lambik-like aroma with raspberry, along with a light medicinal note . Dry and tart funky flavour with nice subdued berries. IÂ’m stunned. This is really authentic fruit lambic

Draught @Â Himmeriget, Copenhagen. Pours reddish brown with a small head. Aroma of tartish berries, funky yeasiness, wood, sourness and raspberries. Taste is funky, yeasty, tartish and sourish with some sourness, wood, raspberries and vanilla. Finish is earthy, funky and woody with loads of berries, vanilla and raspberry juice. Awesome beer.

From Tap. TrÃ¼bes orange rotliches Bier mit einer mittelgroÃŸen leicht pinken Schaumkrone. Geruch nach leicht sÃ¤uerlichen roten FrÃ¼chten, Himbeeren, sehr frisch. Geschmack fruchtig sÃ¤uerlich, sehr frisch, Himbeeren, rote Beeren, erfrischend.
Tap at Himmeriget, Copenhagen. Colour is deep red with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Berries, blueberries, red berries, sweetness, dryness and sourness.

[emailÂ protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Red colour,clear. Red cherry sour nose, slight funk, not much, krieky, sort of bright red cherry. Med bodied, intense, long cherry berry finish. Real nice.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Pours raspberry with low tanned head 
Aromas of raspberries, blackberries, cracked garden branch,
Taste has notes of red currant, cracked garden branch, garden leaves, raspberries
Hazy copper.. Thin white lacing.. Soft sweet Berries fruit... Fizzy.. Juicy fruit.. Light sweet floral fruit.. Juicy fruit.. Big raspberry fruit.. Juicy fruit
Bottle. Ruby purple pour with beige head. Light blackberry jam, fruit, tart and sweet aromas. Flavors are tart, blueberry and funk.

Bottle via PUBÂ’R. Pours turbid ruby/orange with frothy, off-white head. Nose is rich raspberry, blackberry, vinous fruit, mild oak. Tastes tart, with huge berry notes of black and rasp, vinous fruit, mild oaky tannins, and a complex finish. Delicious.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy reddish brown with a small foamy white head. Aromas of funk, tart, berry. Flavor followed the nose with tons of funk, tartness, sour, and berry. Medium body, slick texture, bubbly carbonation, dry and tart finish.

Pours murky raspberry with low brownish white head. Aroma of raspberries, tons of them, with blackberries, bretta, light red grapes and baking soda in the background. Smells wonderful! Taste is rich raspberry tart with mellow barrel notes adding a sweetness before a funky sour finish. Light, crisp body with average carbonation.
Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy pale red color with a small white head. Has a fruity sour blackberry aroma. Fruity sour tart blackberry flavor. Has a fruity sour tart blackberry finish.

650 (I think), capped. Thanks, R! Pours a cloudy dark ebony with a loose off-white head. Sweet soft berry nose. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Berries and light ferment tang on the mid palate. Wonderful beer. Soft dry finish.

Bottle. Light hazy red with a medium sized off white/pink head with good retention and lace. Nose has lots of berries. Juicy blackberries and raspberries, citrus and minerals. Flavour also has berries forward; blackberries, raspberries, citrus, minerals, light hay, wood. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, light/medium sweet and sour. Fruity and fresh, pleasant to drink.
Drank at a bottle share with my fellow workers at Jersey Girl Brewing Company! Usually not huge on Sours, but this one knocked it out of the park, awesome complexity, well done!

Pours a lovely deep lustrous red with a large white head with reddish tints that quickly settles. Aromas of raspberry, blueberry, funk, red currant with vinous and oak notes. Taste is quite fruity with vinous structure and slightly sour. Mouthfeel is quite thin with medium carbonation.

Sampled at the Funkatorium (5/18/15). Ruby amber clear with pink creamy lacing head. Very nice fruity-berry aroma and tart notes. Medium body with medium carbonation. Starts and stays fruity and tart, with nice berry notes. Finish is fruity and tart with just a bit of lactic quality. Very nice sour.

500ml bottle into snifter glass, cloudy pink-hued purple color with off-pink head. Aroma notes of fresh tart raspberries/blueberries and lactic. Taste adds oak, vanilla and tad cream. Light-medium body, moderate carbonation, lively, creamy with light tart berry finish. Excellent barrel aged berry sour ale.
Sweet and tangy cherry and berries make this very quaffable. Tart without being heavy. Quite refreshing.

Reddish purple hue... Aroma of raspberries and blackberries, funk, tart berries... Flavor is light and effervescent, tart berries, funk... Blackberry tart finish... Great beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle - pours purple off white head - nose/taste of blackberry, raspberry, sour lactic acid and funk - medium body
On tap at Funkatorium. Nice raspberry aroma. Huge raspberry taste. Very sour with a surprising clean finish.
Amazing sour...one of the best beers IÂ’ve had in a while (or ever?)... Definite sweet tart taste, but not overwhelming

Pours bright ruby into a tulip. Pink head with good retention recedes leaving scant sheets. Sour blackberry and raspberry aromas. Tart with blackberry and raspberry seeds front to back and into the lasting earthy red wind and oak tannin finish.
Draft. Darker red with a pink head of foam. The aroma has rich raspberries and some woody, oaky notes. Strong berry acidity. Delicious. Medium body and higher carbonation.

Sampled at the Societe Party 2016. It poured a hazy amber color with a white head. The aroma was of berries, wood and some funk. The taste was similar to the aroma with more wood, funk, berry, brett and a nice tartness. Good stuff.

500ml bottle from Charles Street Liquor. Aroma: omg! This is really awesome! Nose of berries including some raspberries, blackberries and even a hint of cherries. This is pretty tart which gives me goose bumps in my cheeks. App: dark pink reddish, off white with pink tint head, great lacing. Taste and palate: light to medium body, velvety, creamy, smooth, light sweetness, dry acidity finish. Overall: wow! This is so awesome! So well balanced. The velvety mouthfeel so well balanced with the sweetness and acidity. This could be a blend of RosÃ© de Gambrinus and Dunham Saison Cassis RÃ©serve. So good! Wish I bought 10 bottles of this awesome beer but this is my only one.
Ruby color with minimal fizzy white pink head. Aroma is jammy berries, red wine, oak, and vanilla. Taste is tart andjammy sweet. Palate is overcarbed and the oak is too strong. Otherwise very good.
Thanks, Carl. Tried at an awesome Wicked Weed tasting. Dark red colored. One of the winners of the night. Wine, blackberry, raspberry, oak, pleasantly tart, immensely drinkable. Wow.
Aromas of raspberry, merlot. Deep, clear dark red, with a mostly lasting white head. Fruity, loaded with raspberry and blackberry. Medium bodied.
Tart berry aromas with a red wine undertone. Light white head and dark red body. Flavors of tart rasberry and some blackberry with minor red wine. Crisp and tart on the palate.
Beautiful color. Sour berry notes, funky. Very crisp and tart. Definitely tastes like sour raspberries.

11/15/15. 500mL bottle during RyanÂ’s epic birthday tasting! This was one of the favorites of the day, methinks. Purplish pour with a nice pink head, good lacing. Nice berry aroma, mild funk and tart, light oak and wine. Awesome flavor, sour, funky, loads of berry, a bit of oak, wine, vanilla. Right up my alley - Delish!

Pours ruby in color with a small off white head. The aroma is of fruit berries, jam like fruit quality, a touch of tartness, and some wood. Flavor is more raspberry over blackberry. There is a sharp tartness with a subtle sour like taste in the finish. I noticed a mild grape skin taste. Overall a fine brew with a simple body.
Pink / ruby body with a thin pinkish cap. Blackberries and raspberries jump out in the aroma. Lovely flavor. High drinkability. Tart but not assertively so. Delicious.

Refrigerated 0.5 L brown bottle, bottled on August 21, 2015, poured into a glass. Hazy red with small off-white head. Aroma is tart berries, medium body, lower carbonation, and some small-bubble lacing. Taste is wood, earthy, and some tart berries. I am always expecting great things and end up with pretty good beer.

375 mL bottle shared by Gus in line at 4 Elf. The pour is a reddish ambery orange with a thin soapy head and some good lace. The aroma is really good. Tart and light with blackberry and raspberry. Fruit skins and a light sourness. The flavor is good. Lots of fruit. It's lighter on the sour and funk, but remains well balanced. The mouth feel is a little light, slightly over carbonated and carries a lovely lingering tart fruit out the back side 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap @ Wicked Weed Funkatorium. Sort of a reddish-purple colored beer with white foam. Lots of tangy, tart raspberry to the aroma. ThereÂ’s a slight jammy and seedy quality to it as well, more on the blackberry side of things there. Some lemon juice as well. Good flavor of berries and plenty of acidity. Slight fruity sweetness, a touch of oak, and a mild tannic quality. Good stuff.

bottle shared at a share .. . plum colour .. medium head, dainty lacing .. summer berry, sour grain .. . mouth has zest, finish is abrupt yet fine .. good but not quite the point . . .. englishmen do like to get in a dress, any excuse.

Poured a deep pinko purple color with a white head. Aroma was huge blackberry, sweet tart, red wine, grain. Flavor was just as bright, really juicy dark berries, red wine oak and tannin, sweet tart with a mild grainy finish. Another killer wicked weed beer.

Pours clear reddish brown with a thick, though not long-lasting, pinkish buff head. Sour blackberry and raspberry dominate the aroma - no surprise there. A little malt manages to make an appearance. Flavor will make your face do calisthenics, but it is very pleasing with berries galore, almost more a raspberry/blackberry wine than a beer but with hints of malts and hops that remind you this is indeed a beer. A little wine-infused wood character makes itself known in the finish. Body is on the thin side, but fizz is good and lasts. Distinctive and a delight for sour lovers.

500 ml. bottled 8.21.2015. Pours copper with a ruby tint and a film of purple-white cream on top. Nose is fresh, lightly tart blackberries and raspberries, with an undercurrent of toffee. Taste is the same with only a bit more sour than the aroma, plus some red wine. Long finish has some faint, soggy wooden notes. Medium body has a high carbonation bordering on unpleasant. Tasty balance of malt, wine and tart berry but this seems more of a fruit beer than a sour. Not real complex, with very little woody tannin, funk or vinegar notes.

500ml bottle enjoyed @ home, thanks to nofunsally. Pours hazy reddish ruby with a small off-white head. Aroma is blackberries, raspberries, citrus, wood, and a hint of dark dried fruits. Flavour is tart, light sweet and medium sour. Medium bodied, average carbonation. Finish is fresh, fruit and mild. Very drinkable.

Pours a clear reddish purple with a slight very light pink head. Aromas of blackberries and raspberries with a white wine and pez-like aroma. Almost minerally. Taste is medium sourness. Pretty spot on. One of the best WW beers IÂ’ve had.

On tap at The Hop Yard, Raleigh (Wicked Weed tap takeover for their 1 year anniversary party). Reddish-purple pour with a short off-white head. Nose is tart berry and faint oak. Sour taste of raspberry and blackberry with noticeable Earth and damp oak. A nicely done sour.

500ml bottle thanks to Chris. Pours out a amberish purple topped with a small head. Nose is berries tartness funk raspberry jam blackberry. Taste is more of the sweetness blackberry raspberry jam oak and funk.

375ml bottle. Pours an amazing mostly clear ruby red color with a lasting off-white head and good lacing. The aroma is intense tart raspberry and blackberry with a touch of funk. Excellent tart flavor, really intense and lactic with strong berry flavors. Sharp and acidic with medium body. Overall I really like this one! Better than 90% of the dog shit American sours out there.

Very very pretty pour. Deep reddish purple with two fingers of offwhite head and a vibrant carbonation. The nose is very bright with lots of fresh berry and wood. Raspberry, blackberry, cherry and fresh cut oak. A light acidity shows in the aroma and is forefront in the flavor. A lightly woody/oaky note rounds out the finish. Medium bodied with a wonderful carbonation and tart finish.
Incredibly full bodied. Gotten in trade. Big colour, aroma. More blackberry than raspberry and extra special richness.
Bottle from Bestway. Nicely tart. Lots of fruit. Juicy and bursting with berry. Really tasty. Could drink a lot of this.

Draft at the Funkatorium. Pours hazy burgundy red with a fizzy light pink head. Tastes like blackberry, raspberry, light yeast, some dry cracker malt, and funky wood. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like blackberry, raspberry, funky wood, and some earthy malt.

Tap at Funkatorium. Pours rich ruby. Aroma is blackberries, raspberries, oak, tart esters, and soft vanilla. Flavor is rich berries, light tartness, dry barrel character, and soft sweetness. Light/medium body.

Tap at the Funkatorium - pours hazy red, white head. Sour red fruits, especially the raspberry. Reminds me of a sour lambic thatÂ’s a bit watered down. The sourness isnÂ’t aggressive, but it is definitely present.

Draft at funkatorium. Pours Amber with a reddish-white head. Leaves trace lacing in the glass. Berry and Brett notes on the nose. Tart on the tongue with some solid berry notes. Finished clean. Solid but not as outstanding as some of their other sours. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

courtesy of JÃ©rÃ´me Rebetez - clear reddish beer with a poor head retention; light woody aroma with notes of blackberries and sour cherries; notes of acetone; quite full-bodied, light chewy and pretty sourish; moderate carbonation, dry and sourish fruity aftertaste where the raspberries appear; herbal and tart - very nice

Sample at the Funkatorium. Pours a hazy dark ruby-amber color with a medium foamy pinkish-white head that recedes gradually to a film. Small patches of lacing on the glass. Aroma of tart berries, oak and malt. Medium body with flavors of blackberry, funky yeast, oak and malt. The finish is moderately sour with a lingering berry aftertaste. Good beer all around.

500ml bottle in a Mason jar. Pours hazy ruby/brown with an off-white head. Aroma of light sourness/tartness, some raspberry and blackberry, pale malts, and light Brett dryness. Flavor the same with a nice blend. Average texture. A pretty good beer, but I still feel like Wicked Weed could be doing much better sours after a couple IÂ’ve had.

On tap at the Funkatorium. Cloudy red, with a pink head. Smells like raspberries, which is to be expected, and citrusy notes. Also some red wine. Very tart, very sour. Lemon and oak, some raspberry. Clean, quenching finish.

Pours like a sour brown (hazy rusty brown) with no head. Nose is sour berries with barrel notes and yeast. Light medium body with a thinner palate and nice quiet tartness. Taste is a simple quiet framboise. Fresh and jammy berries, lemon juice and grape jelly. Slightly acidic with a malty sweet palate. Nice.
From bottle, clear deep burnt orange, and Ruby. Nose is nice and sour, raspberry, funk. Medium light body lightly sweet, medium sourness, light funk, some acidity. Well balanced, great beer.
Bottle to glass. Pours a reddish brown color with an off white head. Aroma is a nice tartness that fades into a less tart but wonderfully sweet berry flavor. Very palatable. Thanks Taylor!
bottle shared by Shad, thanks! Tons of berry flavors, id say the raspberry takes over here, tarter than the angel beers. More of a traditional american berry sour. Long tart finish. Nice!
Bottle thanks to Rainer. Pours a hazy amber ruby with medium frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is strong berries, wood, funk. Medium mouth, wood, funk, berry, brett, nice tartness, very good.
Reddish/purple color. Pink toned head. Fragrant and delicious. Berries, leather, hay, lemons, nice sourness, Brett, yogurt. Awesome.
Dark Ruby pour. Pink head. Little lacing. Huge florally blackberry aroma. Nice tart fruity berry taste. Nice.

Super complex, with an impressive balance of sour wild berry and raspberry fruit flavors above funky yeast and barnyard undertones. This is quite refreshing, complex and true to the style, but it does think out just a touch on the finish.

4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey for the Wicked Weed DC Debut event. Poured a very red color, hazy, with a pink head. Aroma was delicious smelling raspberries. Tart raspberry notes. Tart juice. Delicious.

4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey for the Wicked Weed DC Debut event. Reddish with off-white head. Aromas of vinegar, floral notes, berries. Tastes of berries and tart wine. Medium-light body with a dry finish. Great stuff.
Draft. Clear deep golden amber color, fluffy white head. Beautiful fruit and berry aroma with a touch of black pepper. Taste is softly sour berries, dry finish. Delicious.
Bottle. Thanks for grabbing this, Wayne. Pours a dark red with minimal/nonexistent head. Aroma of tart, funk, and berries, especially raspberries. Taste of berries, tart, just perfect carbonation.

Dark red color with white head. Aroma contains a lot of raspberries, red wine, and a hint of blackberries. Flavor is rather sour but also sweet with raspberries standing out. A vinegary presence is also there. Overall a very nice sour beer.
500 ml bottle from Wicked Weed. Red purple color. Light funky noe. Blackberry and light fruit. Very nice.

On tap at Funkatorium. Side by side with Red Angel. Just as good, but in a more subtle, intellectual way. Maroon almost opaque pour with appropriate white head. Raspberry tartness balanced nicely by blackberries. Sour, but not overly so. Same with funk. Hints of dark cherry. More like a chilly evening beer-to-enjoy-by-the-fire. Mellow red wine notes. Subtle in all the right ways. Loved it.

On draft at Wicked Weed Funkatorium. Poured ruby red with slick lace splotches. Sour nose. Tart blackberry and raspberry flavor. Touch of black cherry. Best American sour IÂ’ve had east of Russian River.

Bottle. Pours a clear (unless dregs added) slightly reddish hued color with a slight off white head. Nice fruit aroma. Medium/light mouthfeel. tart raspberry start that trails off to a funky finish. Some woods notes as well. Very little evidence of the abv. Overall, tasty but pricey.

Draft @ Funkatorium. One of my favorites of the trip. Full barrel character of sweet vanilla, big oak with a vinous quality. Lots of blackberry, lightly tart. I am starting to feel for Wicked WeedÂ’s beers. Softer, more subtle sour/tartness, with a known but yet still funkiness to them. Very approachable and sold my wife on sour beers. Or at least wicked weed sours.

Pours a deep purple reddish brown on tap worth minimal ring of bubbly head. Aroma is big on the fruit, sweetness giving way to sour tartness as you let it settle. Taste is less impressive, but still some nice funky sour fruits, berries galore. Mouth is less than the nose, but that is not a bad thing in my book, the most Belgian of any American sour I think I have ever had.

On tap at Wicked Weed. Pours a bright purplish pink. Aroma is rich of sweet blackberry pancake syrup. Flavor is 75% sweet, 25% tart of berry, mainly of the black variety. Dry and crisp with a sweet berry finish.

Draft to snifter at Wicked Weed. Looks good for the style; a semi-transparent ruby with eggshell head that has a slight reddish tint to it. Smells good too; tart and fruity with notes of raspberries. Tastes like it smells, but less robust. Solid on the palate. Good beer, but a hair softer on the tongue than the nose.
On tap at Wicked Weed. Pours a maroon color with pink head. Tart, big berry, slight wood aromas. Blackberry, raspberry, tart flavors. A more subtle sour beer.
